cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 75 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest tonight, then turning north toward the south-central Louisiana coast and the lower Mississippi Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south-central Louisiana coast near Intracoastal City–Morgan City

weather_observation.watch_coast: Biloxi MS to the Mississippi/Alabama border (Tropical Storm Watch)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City to Grand Isle LA (Hurricane Warning); Mouth of the Pearl River to Grand Isle and Intracoastal City to Cameron LA (Tropical Storm Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from eastern Texas border through Louisiana and Mississippi
weather_observation.wind: Intermittent tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 mph) possible Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor coastal inundation below 3 ft possible on the upper TX coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 4–8 in with localized higher amounts, producing flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Brief tornadoes in outer rain-bands; restricted visibility and rough seas affecting vessel traffic in Sabine–Neches Waterway
